description: Renalfa has acquired a 258MW solar project in Teleorman, Romania, which it expects to start commercial operation in 2027.
Vienna-based Renalfa IPP announced the acquisition of a 258-MWac solar project in northern Romania and unveiled plans to add to the energy storage capacity.
Romania awards a 15-year CfD contract for a 190 MW solar project, supported by the European Modernisation Fund.
Set to begin operations in mid-2025, the project will include over 285,000 LONGi PV modules and is currently the largest solar installation in Romania.
Romanian power distributor Premier Energy PLC acquires a majority stake in a company that holds the rights to a 49-MWdc solar project.
